file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-15-03-04 - FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the flood/storm light assemblies. B. There are three flood/storm light assemblies, two for pilot and central zones and one flood/storm light assembly for the copilot zone. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - RE- ALL 33-15-03-000-801-A MOVAL FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - IN- ALL 33-15-03-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-15-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-15-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove one of the three flood/storm light assemblies. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223/224 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Where applicable H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the (left or right) light panel of the glareshield panel, set the FLOODLT knob to the OFF position. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connectors (1) from the flood/storm light assembly. (2) Loosen the dzus fasteners (3) which attach the flood/storm light assembly (2) to the glareshield panel bottom. (3) Remove the flood/storm light assembly (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-15-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Flood/storm Light Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 223 224 B DET. A 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS 2. FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY 1. ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS 3. DZUS FASTENERS DET. B 3. DZUS FASTENERS 145AMM330063.MCE C EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-15-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-15-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. FLOOD/STORM LIGHT ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install one of the three flood/storm light assemblies. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-15-00-700-801-A/500 FLOOD/STORM LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223/224 Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Where applicable I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the flood/storm light assembly (2) in its installation position. (2) Tighten the dzus fasteners (3). (3) Connect the electrical connectors (1) to the flood/storm light assembly. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do the Flood/Storm Lights Operational Test ( AMM TASK 33-15-00-700-801-A/500).
